snippet: Trained to battle Israel, Hezbollah’s Lebanese Shiite guerrillas are pushing into a very different fight, against fellow Arab Muslims trying to topple President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Hezbollah's Lebanese Shiite guerrilla fighters, recruited and trained to battle Israel and defend Lebanon, are increasingly directing their efforts against fellow Arab Muslims trying to topple Pres Bashar al-Assad in Syria; group finds itself struggling to preserve credibility at home and fend off array of new challenges abroad as it fights to preserve Assad’s rule.
lead_paragraph: Trained to battle Israel, Hezbollah’s Lebanese Shiite guerrillas are pushing into a very different fight, against fellow Arab Muslims trying to topple President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.seo: Hezbollah Takes Risks by Fighting Rebels in Syria
headline.main: Hezbollah Takes Risks by Fighting Rebels in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
